The "Exports, Jobs, and Growth Act of 1996" includes amendments to income levels, investment insurance ceiling, and financing ceiling under the Overseas Private Investment Corporation. The "Exports, Jobs, and Growth Act of 1996" includes amendments to income levels, investment insurance ceiling, and financing ceiling under the Overseas Private Investment Corporation. Section 235(a)(1) is amended to increase the amount from $13.5 billion to $25 billion. Section 235(a)(2)(A) is amended to increase the amount from $9.5 billion to $20 billion. Section 235(a)(3) is amended to change the year from 1996 to 2001. Section 231 is amended to focus on increasing US exports and trade policy. The "Exports, Jobs, and Growth Act of 1996" includes amendments to income levels, investment insurance ceiling, and financing ceiling under the Overseas Private Investment Corporation. Section 106 focuses on the Board of Directors. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to make changes to the composition of the Board of Directors, including the addition of the President of the Corporation, the Administrator of the Agency for International Development, and the United States Trade Representative. The United States Trade Representative may designate a Deputy to serve on the Board. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to change the Board of Directors composition, adding the President of the Corporation, the Administrator of the Agency for International Development, and the United States Trade Representative. A Deputy U.S. Trade Representative may serve on the Board, and a Chairman and Vice Chairman will be designated by the President from among the Board Directors. TITLE II--TRADE AND DEVELOPMENT AGENCY

SEC. 201. TRADE AND DEVELOPMENT AGENCY AUTHORIZATION.

Section 661(f)(1)(A) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to authorize $40,000,000 for fiscal 1997 and necessary sums for fiscal year 1998.

TITLE III--EXPORT PROMOTION PROGRAMS WITHIN THE INTERNATIONAL TRADE ADMINISTRATION

SEC. 301. EXPORT PROMOTION AUTHORIZATION.

Section 202 of the Export Administration Amendments Act of 1985 is amended to authorize appropriations. Section 202 of the Export Administration Amendments Act of 1985 is amended to authorize appropriations of $240,000,000 for fiscal year 1997 and necessary sums for fiscal year 1998. TITLE IV--TRADE PROMOTION COORDINATING COMMITTEE

SEC. 401. STRATEGIC EXPORT PLAN.

Amends the Export Enhancement Act of 1988 to identify means for providing coordinated export promotion services to small- and medium-sized businesses and establish priorities for promoting U.S. exports and free market reforms in the Middle East to stimulate job growth.

SEC. 402. IMPLEMENTATION OF PRIMARY OBJECTIVES. The Trade Promotion Coordinating Committee is tasked with identifying and eliminating overlap and duplication in Federal export promotion activities, promoting better coordination between State, Federal, and private sector export promotion activities, and including these matters in the annual report by September 30, 1997. SEC. 403. PRIVATE SECTOR DEVELOPMENT IN THE UKRAINE. The Trade Promotion Coordinating Committee will report on its efforts to promote US trade and investment for private sector development in Ukraine in the 1997 annual report.
